v.v: “I was ready to be sought out by those who did not ask; I was ready to be found by those who did not seek.
I have spread out my hands all day to a stubborn people,
They are a people who continually offend me,
They sit among the graves and keep watch all night,
They say, ‘Stand away, do not come near to me, for I am holier than you.’
Look, it is written before me:
for their sins and the sins of their fathers together,” says Yahweh.
This is what Yahweh says, “As when juice is found in a cluster of grapes,
I will bring descendants from Jacob, and from Judah ones who will possess my mountains.
Sharon will become a pasture for the flocks, and the Valley of Achor a resting place for herds,
But you who abandon Yahweh, who forget my holy mountain,
I will appoint you for the sword, and you will all bow down to the slaughter,
This is what the Lord Yahweh says,
Look, my servants will shout with joy because of gladness of heart,
You will leave behind your name as a curse for my chosen ones to speak; I, the Lord Yahweh, will kill you;
Whoever pronounces a blessing on the earth will be blessed by me, the God of truth.

v: I said, ‘Here I am! Here I am!’ to a nation that did not call on my name.
who walk in a way that is not good, who have walked after their own thoughts and plans!
offering sacrifices in gardens, and burning incense on brick tiles.
and eat pork with the broth of foul meat in their dishes.
These things are smoke in my nose, a fire that burns all day long.
I will not keep quiet, for I will pay them back; I will repay them into their laps,
“I will repay them for burning incense on the mountains and for mocking me on the hills.
I will therefore measure out their past deeds into their laps.”
when one says, ‘Do not ruin it, for there is good in it,’
this is what I will do for my servants’ sake: I will not ruin them all.
My chosen ones will possess the land, and my servants will live there.
for my people who seek me.
who prepare a table for Fortune,
and fill wine glasses of mixed wine for Destiny.
because when I called, you did not answer; when I spoke, you did not listen.
But you did what was evil in my sight and and chose to do what displeases me.”
“Look, my servants will eat, but you will be hungry;
look, my servants will drink, but you will be thirsty;
look, my servants will rejoice, but you will be put to shame.
but you will cry because of the pain of the heart, and will wail because of the crushing of the spirit.
I will call my servants by another name.
Whoever takes an oath on the earth will swear by me, the God of truth,
because the former troubles will be forgotten, for they will be hidden from my eyes.

v.v: For see, I am about to create new heavens and a new earth;
But you will be glad and rejoice forever in what I am about to create. See, I am about to create Jerusalem as a joy, and her people as a delight.
I will rejoice over Jerusalem and be glad over my people;
Never again will an infant live there only a few days;
They will build houses and inhabit them, and they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
No longer will they build a house and another live in it; they will not plant, and another eat;
They will not labor in vain, nor give birth to dismay.
Before they call, I will answer; and while they are still speaking, I will hear.
The wolf and the lamb will graze together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox;

v: and the former things will not be remembered or be brought to mind.
weeping and cries of distress will no longer be heard in her.
nor will an old man die before his time.
One who dies at one hundred years old will be considered a young person.
Anyone who fails to reach the age of one hundred years old will be considered cursed.
for as the days of trees will be the days of my people. My chosen will fully outlive the work of their hands.
For they are the children of those blessed by Yahweh, and their descendants with them.
but dust will be the serpent’s food.
They will no longer hurt nor destroy on all my holy mountain,” says Yahweh.
